"Vengeance, arise from thy infernal Bed;</br>And pour thy Tempest on his Guilty Head!"</br>Thou Heav'n's Decree, in Thunder's Sound,</br>Shook the dark Abyss profound.—</br>The unchain'd Furies come!</br>Pale Melancholy stalks from Hell:</br>Th' abortive Offspring of her Womb,</br>Despair and Anguish round her yell.</br>By sleepless Terror Saul possess'd,</br>Deep feels the Fiend within his tortur'd Breast.</br>Midnight Spectres round him howl:</br>Before his Eyes</br>In Troops they rise;</br>And Seas of Horror overwhelm his Soul.

Haste, to JESSE'S Son repair:</br>He best can sweep the Lyre,</br>Wake the solemn sounding Air,</br>And lead the vocal Choir:</br>On ev'ry String soft-breathing Raptures dwell,</br>To sooth the Throbbings of the troubled Breast;</br>Whose magic Voice can bid the Tide of Passion swell,</br>Or lull the raging Storm to Rest.</br>Sunk on his Couch, and loathing Day,</br>The heav'n-forsaken Monarch lay:</br>To the sad Couch the Shepherd now drew near;</br>And, while th' obedient Choir stood round,</br>Prepar'd to catch the Soul commanding Sound,</br>He drop'd a gen'rous Tear.—</br>Thy pitying Aid, O GOD, impart!</br>For lo, thy poison'd Arrows drink his Heart!

The mighty Song from Chaos rose.—</br>Around his Throne the formless Atoms sleep,</br>And drowsy Darkness broods upon the Deep.—</br>Confusion, wake!</br>Bid the Realms of Chaos shake!</br>Rouse him from his dread Repose!—</br>Hark!  loud Discord breaks her Chain:</br>The hostile Atoms clash with deafning Roar:</br>Her hoarse Voice thunders through the drear Domain;</br>And kindles ev'ry Element to War.—</br>"Tumult cease!</br>Sink to Peace!</br>Let there be Light" — Th' Almighty said:</br>And lo, the radiant Sun,</br>Flaming from his orient Bed,</br>His endless Course begun.</br>See, the twinkling Pleiads rise:</br>Thy Star, Orion, reddens in the Skies:</br>While slow around the northern Plain,</br>Arcturus wheels his nightly Wane.</br>Thy Glories too, refulgent Moon, be sun;</br>Thy mystic Mazes, and thy changeful Ray:</br>O fairest of the starry Throng!</br>Thy solemn Orb of Light</br>Guides the triumphant Carr of Night</br>O'er Silver Clouds, and sheds a softer Day!

Ye Planets, and each circling Constellation,</br>In Songs harmonious tell your Generation!</br>Oh, while yon radiant Seraph turns the Spheres,</br>And on the stedfast Pole-Star stands sublime;</br>Wheel your Rounds</br>To heav'nly Sounds;</br>And sooth his Song-inchanted Ears,</br>With your celestial Chime.</br>In dumb Surprize the list'ning Monarch lay;</br>(His Woes suspended by sweet Music's Sway)</br>And awe struck, with uplifted  Eye</br>Mus'd on the new-born Wonders of the Sky.

Lead the soothing Verse along:</br>He feels, he feels the Pow'r of Song.—</br>Ocean hastens to his Bed:</br>The lab'ring Mountain rears his rock-encumber'd Head:</br>Down his steep and shaggy Side</br>The Torrent rolls his thund'ring Tide;</br>Then smooth and clear, along the fertile Plain</br>Winds his majestic Waters to the distant Main.</br>Flocks and Herds the Hills adorn:</br>The Lark, high-soaring, hails the Morn.</br>And while along yon crimson-clouded Steep</br>The slow Sun steals into the golden Deep,</br>Hark!  the solemn Nightingale</br>Warbles to the woodland Dale.</br>See, descending Angels show'r</br>Heav'n's own Bliss on Eden's Bow'r:</br>Peace on Nature's Lap reposes;</br>Pleasure strews her guiltless Roses:</br>Joys divine in Circles move,</br>Link'd with Innocence and Love.</br>Hail, happy Love, with Innocence combin'd!</br>All hail, ye sinless Parents of Mankind!

They paus'd: — the Monarch, prostrate on his Bed,</br>Submissive bow'd his Head;</br>Ador'd the Works of boundless Pow'r divine:</br>Then, Anguish-struck, he cry'd (and smote his Breast)</br>Why, why is Peace the welcome Guest</br>Of ev'ry Heart but Mine!</br>Now let the solemn Numbers flow,</br>Till he feel that Guilt is Woe.</br>Heav'nly Harp, in mournful Strain</br>O'er yon weeping Bow'r complain:</br>What Sounds of bitter Pangs I hear!</br>What Lamentations round my Ear!</br>In vain, devoted Pair, these Tears ye shed:</br>Peace with Innocence is fled.</br>The Messengers of Grace depart:</br>Death glare, and shakes the dreadful Dart!</br>Ah, whither fly ye, by yourselves abhor'd,</br>To shun that frowning Cherub's firey Sword?—</br>Lo!</br>Hapless, hapless Pair,</br>Goaded by Despair,</br>Forlorn, thro' desert Climes they go!</br>Wake, my Lyre!  can Pity sleep,</br>When Heav'n is mov'd, and Angels weep!</br>Flow, ye melting Numbers, flow;</br>Till he feel, that Guilt is Woe.—

The King, with Pride, and Shame, and Anguish, torn,</br>Shot Fury from his Eyes, and Scorn.</br>The glowing Youth,</br>Bold in Truth,</br>(So still should Virtue guilty Pow'r engage)</br>With Brow undaunted met his Rage.</br>See, his Cheek kindles into generous Fire:</br>Stern, he bends him o'er his Lyre;</br>And, while the Doom of Guilt he sings,</br>Shakes Horror from the tortur'd Strings.</br>What Sounds of Terror and Distress</br>Rend yon howling Wilderness!</br>The dreadful Thunders sound;</br>The forked Lightnings flash along the Ground.</br>Why yawns that deep'ning Gulph below?—</br>'Tis for Heav'n's rebellious Foe:—</br>Fly, ye Sons of ISRAEL, fly,</br>Who dwells in Korah's guilty Tents must die!—</br>They sink! — Have Mercy, Lord! — Their Cries</br>In dreadful Tumult rise!</br>Hark, from the Deep their loud Laments I hear!</br>They lessen now, and lessen on the Ear!</br>Now, Destruction's Strife is o'er!</br>The countless Host</br>For ever lost!</br>The Gulph is clos'd! — Their Cries are heard no more!—</br>But Oh, my Lyre, what Accents can relate</br>Sinful Man's appointed Fate!</br>He comes, he comes!  th' avenging GOD!</br>Clouds and Darkness round him rowl:</br>Tremble, Earth!  Ye mountains, nod!</br>He bows the Skies, and shakes the Pole.</br>The gloomy Banners of his Wrath unfurl'd,</br>He calls the Floods, to drown a guilty World:</br>"Ruin, lift thy baleful Head;</br>Rouze the guilty World from Sleep:</br>Lead up the Billows from their cavern'd Bed,</br>And burst the Rocks that chain thee in the Deep."—</br>Now, th' impetuous Torrents rise;</br>The hoarse-ascending Deluge roars:</br>Down rush the Cataracts from the Skies;</br>The swelling Waves o'erwhelm the Shores.</br>Just, O god, is thy Decree!</br>Shall guilty Man contend with Thee!</br>Lo, Hate and Envy, sea-intomb'd,</br>And Rage with Lust in Ruin sleep;</br>And scoffing Luxury is doom'd</br>To glut the vast and rav'nous Deep!—</br>In vain from Fate th' astonish'd Remnant flies:—</br>"Shrink, ye Rocks!  Ye Oceans, rise!"—</br>The tottering Cliffs no more the Floods controul;</br>Sea following Sea ingulphs the Ball:</br>O'er the sunk Hills the watry Mountains rowl,</br>And wide Destruction swallows all!—</br>Now fiercer let th' impassion'd Numbers glow:</br>Swell the Song, ye mighty Choir!</br>Wing your dreadful Darts with Fire!</br>Hear me, Monarch! — Guilt is Woe!—

Thus while the frowning Shepherd pour'd along</br>The deep impetuous Torrent of his Song;</br>SAUL, stung by dire Despair,</br>Gnash'd his Teeth, and tore his Hair:</br>From his Blood, by Horror chill'd,</br>A cold and agonizing Sweat distill'd:</br>Then, foaming with unutterable Smart,</br>He aim'd a Dagger at his Heart.</br>His watchful Train prevent the Blow;</br>And call each lenient Balm, to sooth his frantic Woe:</br>But pleas'd, the Shepherd now beheld</br>His Pride by Heav'n's own Terrors quell'd:</br>Then bade his potent Lyre controul</br>The mighty Storm that rent his Soul.

Cease your Cares:  the Body's Pain</br>A sweet Relief may find:</br>But Gums and lenient Balms are vain,</br>To heal the wounded Mind.</br>Come, fair Repentance, from the Skies</br>O sainted Maid, with upcast Eyes!</br>Descend in thy celestial Shrowd,</br>Vested in a weeping Cloud!</br>Holy Guide, descend, and bring</br>Mercy from th' eternal King!</br>To his Soul your Beams impart,</br>And whisper Comfort to his Heart!—

They come:  O King, thine Ear incline:</br>Listen to their Voice divine:</br>Their Voice shall every Pang compose,</br>To gentle Sorrow sooth thy Woes;</br>Till each pure Wish to Heav'n shall soar,</br>And Peace return, to part no more!

Behold, obedient to their great Command,</br>The lifted Dagger quits his trembling Hand:</br>Smooth'd is his Brow, where sullen Care</br>And furrow'd Horror couch'd with fell Despair:</br>No more his Eyes with Fury glow;</br>But heav'nly Grief succeeds to hell-born Woe.—</br>See, the Signs of Grace appear:</br>See the soft relenting Tear,</br>Trickling at sweet Mercy's Call!</br>Catch it, Angels, ere it fall!</br>And let the heart-sent Offering rise,</br>Heav'n's best-accepted Sacrifice!—</br>Yet, yet again? — Ah see, the Pang returns!</br>Again with inward Fire his heaving Bosom burns!</br>Now, Shepherds, wake a mightier Strain;</br>Search the deep, heart rending Pain;</br>Till the large Floods of Sorrow roll,</br>And quench the Tortures of his Soul.</br>Almighty LORD, accept his Pang sincere!</br>Let heav'nly Hope dispell each dark Temptation!</br>And, while he pours the penitential Tear,</br>O visit him with thy Salvation!

Stoop from Heav'n, ye raptur'd Throng:</br>Sink, ye swelling Tides of Song!</br>For lo, dissolv'd by Music's melting Pow'r,</br>Celestial Sorrow rolls her plenteous Show'r.</br>O'er his wan Cheek the Colours rise;</br>And Beams of Comfort brighten in his Eyes.</br>Happy King, thy Woes are o'er!</br>Thy God shall wound thy Soul no more:</br>The pitying Father of Mankind</br>Meets the pure-returning Mind.

Now lowly let the rustic Measure glide,</br>To quell the dark Remains of self-consuming Pride;</br>Till Nature's home-sprung Blessings he confess,</br>And own that calm Content is Happiness.—</br>Ye Woods and Lakes, ye Cliffs and Mountains!</br>Haunted Grots, and living Fountains!</br>Listen to your Shepherd's Lay,</br>Whose artless Carols close the Day.</br>Bounding Kids around him throng;</br>The steep Rock echoes back his Song:</br>While all unseen to mortal Eye,</br>Sliding down the evening Sky,</br>Holy Peace, tho' born above,</br>Daughter of Innocence and Love,</br>Quits her Throne and Mansion bright,</br>Her Crowns of Stars, and Robe of Light,</br>Serene, in gentle Smiles array'd,</br>To dwell beneath his Palm-Tree Shade.</br>Hail, meek Angel!  awful Guest!</br>Still pour thy Radiance o'er my Breast!</br>Pride and Hate in Courts may shine:</br>The Shepherd's calm and blameless Tent is Thine!—

Softly, softly breath your Numbers;</br>And wrap his weary'd Soul in Slumbers!</br>Gentle Sleep, becalm his Breast,</br>And close his Eyes in healing Rest!</br>Descend, celestial Visions, ye who wait,</br>GOD'S ministering Pow'rs, at Heav'n's eternal Gate!</br>Ye, who nightly Vigils keep,</br>And rule the silent Realms of Sleep,</br>Exalt the Just to Joys refin'd,</br>And plunge in Woe the guilty Mind,</br>Descend! — Oh, waft him to the Skies,</br>And open all Heav'n's Glories to his Eyes!</br>Beyond yon starry Roof, by Seraphs trod,</br>Where Light's unclouded Fountains blaze;</br>Where Choirs immortal hymn their GOD,</br>Intranc'd in Ecstasy of ceaseless Praise.</br>Angels, heal his Anguish!</br>Your Harps and Voices joyn!</br>His Grief to Bliss shall languish,</br>When sooth'd by Sounds divine.

Behold, with dawning Joy each Feature glows!</br>See, the blissful Tear o'erflows!—</br>The Fiend is fled! — Let Music's Rapture rise:</br>Now Harmony, thy ev'ry Nerve employ:</br>Shake the Dome, and pierce the Skies:</br>Wake him, wake him into Joy.—

What Pow'r can ev'ry Passion's Throe controul?</br>To still the Tempest of the Soul?</br>Celestial Harmony, that mighty Charm is Thine!</br>She, heav'nly-born, came down to visit Earth,</br>When from GOD'S eternal Throne</br>The Beams of all-creative Wisdom shone,</br>And spake fair Order into Birth.</br>At Wisdom's Call she robed yon glittering Skies,</br>Attun'd the Spheres, and taught consenting Orbs to rise.</br>Angels wrapt in Wonder stood,</br>And saw that All was Fair, and All was Good.</br>'Twas then, ye Sons of GOD, in bright Array</br>Ye shouted o'er Creation's Day:</br>Then kindling into Joy,</br>The Morning Stars together sung;</br>And thro' the vast etherial Sky</br>Seraphic Hymns and loud Hosannahs rung.</br>
